trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage Azure virtual machines using Resource Manager templates and PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage Azure virtual machines using Resource Manager templates and PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Easily deploy the most common set of configurations for Azure virtual machines and manage them using Resource Manager templates and PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Easily deploy the most common set of configurations for Azure virtual machines and manage them using Resource Manager templates and PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell

trans-unit.source: PowerShell: Resource Manager deployment
trans-unit.target: PowerShell: Resource Manager deployment

trans-unit.source: PowerShell: Classic deployment
trans-unit.target: PowerShell: Classic deployment

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying and managing Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying and managing Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: For more templates you can use, see [Azure Quickstart Templates](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/templates/) and [App Frameworks](virtual-machines-app-frameworks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more templates you can use, see [Azure Quickstart Templates](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/templates/) and [App Frameworks](virtual-machines-app-frameworks.md).

trans-unit.target: Create a custom virtual machine image

trans-unit.target: Deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and an external load balancer

trans-unit.target: Remove a resource group

trans-unit.target: Sign in to a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Before you get started, make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Before you get started, make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Azure Resource templates and resource groups
trans-unit.target: Understanding Azure Resource templates and resource groups

trans-unit.source: Most applications that are deployed and run in Microsoft Azure are built from a combination of different cloud resource types (such as one or more virtual machines and storage accounts, a SQL database, or a virtual network).
trans-unit.target: Most applications that are deployed and run in Microsoft Azure are built from a combination of different cloud resource types (such as one or more virtual machines and storage accounts, a SQL database, or a virtual network).

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates make it possible for you to deploy and manage these different resources together by using a JSON description of the resources and associated configuration and deployment parameters.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates make it possible for you to deploy and manage these different resources together by using a JSON description of the resources and associated configuration and deployment parameters.

trans-unit.source: After you have defined a JSON-based resource template, you can execute it and use a PowerShell command to deploy the defined resources in Azure.
trans-unit.target: After you have defined a JSON-based resource template, you can execute it and use a PowerShell command to deploy the defined resources in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can run these commands either separately in the PowerShell command shell, or you can integrate them with a script that contains additional automation logic.
trans-unit.target: You can run these commands either separately in the PowerShell command shell, or you can integrate them with a script that contains additional automation logic.

trans-unit.source: The resources you create using Azure Resource Manager templates will be deployed to either a new or existing Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: The resources you create using Azure Resource Manager templates will be deployed to either a new or existing Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: An *Azure resource group* allows you to manage multiple deployed resources together as a logical group; this allows you to manage the overall lifecycle of the group/application and provide management APIs that allow you to:
trans-unit.target: An *Azure resource group* allows you to manage multiple deployed resources together as a logical group; this allows you to manage the overall lifecycle of the group/application and provide management APIs that allow you to:

trans-unit.source: Stop, start, or delete all of the resources within the group at once.
trans-unit.target: Stop, start, or delete all of the resources within the group at once.

trans-unit.source: Apply Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) rules to lock down security permissions on them.
trans-unit.target: Apply Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) rules to lock down security permissions on them.

trans-unit.source: Audit operations.
trans-unit.target: Audit operations.

trans-unit.source: Tag resources with additional metadata for better tracking.
trans-unit.target: Tag resources with additional metadata for better tracking.

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about Azure Resource Manager [here](virtual-machines-azurerm-versus-azuresm.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about Azure Resource Manager [here](virtual-machines-azurerm-versus-azuresm.md).

trans-unit.source: If you're interested in authoring templates, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager templates](resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: If you're interested in authoring templates, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager templates](resource-group-authoring-templates.md).

trans-unit.source: TASK: Deploy a Windows virtual machine
trans-unit.target: TASK: Deploy a Windows virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in this section to deploy a new Azure virtual machine using a Resource Manager template and Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in this section to deploy a new Azure virtual machine using a Resource Manager template and Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: This template creates a single virtual machine in a new virtual network with a single subnet.
trans-unit.target: This template creates a single virtual machine in a new virtual network with a single subnet.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine using a Resource Manager template in the GitHub template repository with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine using a Resource Manager template in the GitHub template repository with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template

trans-unit.source: Here is the content of the JSON file for the template.
trans-unit.target: Here is the content of the JSON file for the template.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create the virtual machine with the template
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create the virtual machine with the template

trans-unit.source: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, and Azure datacenter location, and then run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, and Azure datacenter location, and then run these commands.

trans-unit.source: When you run the **New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment** command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.
trans-unit.target: When you run the **New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment** command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the needed parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the needed parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example.

trans-unit.source: You will see something like this:
trans-unit.target: You will see something like this:

trans-unit.source: You now have a new Windows virtual machine named MyWindowsVM in your new resource group.
trans-unit.target: You now have a new Windows virtual machine named MyWindowsVM in your new resource group.

trans-unit.source: TASK: Create a custom virtual machine image
trans-unit.target: TASK: Create a custom virtual machine image

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in this sections to create a custom virtual machine image in Azure with a Resource Manager template by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in this sections to create a custom virtual machine image in Azure with a Resource Manager template by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: This template creates a single virtual machine from a specified virtual hard disk (VHD).
trans-unit.target: This template creates a single virtual machine from a specified virtual hard disk (VHD).

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template

trans-unit.source: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.
trans-unit.target: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Obtain the VHD
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Obtain the VHD

trans-unit.source: For a Windows-based virtual machine, see [Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure](virtual-machines-create-upload-vhd-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: For a Windows-based virtual machine, see [Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure](virtual-machines-create-upload-vhd-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: For a Linux-based virtual machine, see [Create and upload a Linux VHD in Azure](virtual-machines-linux-create-upload-vhd.md).
trans-unit.target: For a Linux-based virtual machine, see [Create and upload a Linux VHD in Azure](virtual-machines-linux-create-upload-vhd.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create the virtual machine with the template
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create the virtual machine with the template

trans-unit.source: To create an new virtual machine based on the VHD, replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information and run these commands:
trans-unit.target: To create an new virtual machine based on the VHD, replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information and run these commands:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the parameter values, Azure Resource Manager creates the resource group and the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the parameter values, Azure Resource Manager creates the resource group and the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: TASK: Deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and an external load balancer
trans-unit.target: TASK: Deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and an external load balancer

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in these sections to deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and a load balancer with a Resource Manager template using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in these sections to deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and a load balancer with a Resource Manager template using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: This template creates two virtual machines in a new virtual network with a single subnet in a new cloud service, and adds them to an external load-balanced set for incoming traffic to TCP port 80.
trans-unit.target: This template creates two virtual machines in a new virtual network with a single subnet in a new cloud service, and adds them to an external load-balanced set for incoming traffic to TCP port 80.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and a load balancer using a Resource Manager template in the GitHub template repository by using Azure PowerShell commands.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to deploy a multi-virtual-machine application that uses a virtual network and a load balancer using a Resource Manager template in the GitHub template repository by using Azure PowerShell commands.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Examine the JSON file for the template

trans-unit.source: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.
trans-unit.target: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create the deployment with the template
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create the deployment with the template

trans-unit.source: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, Azure location, and then run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, Azure location, and then run these commands.

trans-unit.source: When you run the **New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment** command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters of the JSON file.
trans-unit.target: When you run the **New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment** command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters of the JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the deployment.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the deployment.

trans-unit.source: You would see something like this.
trans-unit.target: You would see something like this.

trans-unit.source: TASK: Remove a resource group
trans-unit.target: TASK: Remove a resource group

trans-unit.source: You can remove any resource group you have created with the **Remove-AzureResourceGroup** command.
trans-unit.target: You can remove any resource group you have created with the **Remove-AzureResourceGroup** command.

trans-unit.source: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct name.
trans-unit.target: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct name.

trans-unit.target: TASK: Sign in to a Windows virtual machine

trans-unit.source: For the detailed steps, see [How to Log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server](virtual-machines-log-on-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: TASK: Display information about a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: TASK: Display information about a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: You can see information about a virtual machine using the **Get-AzureVM** command.
trans-unit.target: You can see information about a virtual machine using the **Get-AzureVM** command.

trans-unit.source: This command returns a virtual machine object that can be manipulated using various other cmdlets to update the state of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This command returns a virtual machine object that can be manipulated using various other cmdlets to update the state of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.
trans-unit.target: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.

trans-unit.target: You will see information about your virtual machine like this:
